meanings.sent1: I will redacted my essay before submitting it.
meanings.sent2: The editor redacted unnecessary details from the article.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked us to redacted our rough drafts before turning them in.
meanings.sent4: She carefully redacted the errors in her report.
meanings.sent5: He always redacted his emails to ensure clarity.

meanings.sent1: The government redacted classified documents to protect national security.
meanings.sent2: The names of the individuals involved were redacted from the report.
meanings.sent3: The spy novel had redacted sections to add suspense.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were redacted like black lines on a page.
meanings.sent5: The redacted parts of the letter left us curious.

meanings.definition: Prepare for publication by obscuring or removing sensitive information.
meanings.sent1: Before releasing the document, they redacted confidential details.
meanings.sent2: The legal team redacted the sensitive information from the contract.
meanings.sent3: The author had to redacted the names of real people in the book.
meanings.sent4: The redacted version of the article was finally approved for print.
meanings.sent5: She carefully redacted the personal information from the form.
